alert.note: Alert for De Kalb; Jackson; Overton; Putnam; Smith (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 5:51PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Overton, southeastern Smith, De Kalb, southeastern Jackson and Putnam Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 550 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Smithville to Livingston. Movement was north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cookeville, Smithville, Livingston, Algood, Baxter, Alexandria, Dowelltown, Liberty, Burgess Falls State Park, Rickman, Center Hill Lake, Edgar Evans State Park and Cummins Falls State Park. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 262 and 293. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: De Kalb; Jackson; Overton; Putnam; Smith
